page.title: 06Housing Action Areas
page.content: In earlier times most of this area's population was employed in the cotton mills. The mills were surrounded by rows of terraced houses. The housewives took pride in keeping their homes clean, often scrubbing the pavements outside their front doors and whitening the step with a 'donkey- stone'. Much of this property dates from l885-l914 and so needs modernising. Some of it falls into Housing Action Areas, allowing older property to qualify for 95% improve- ment grants. Some of the streets near {Rishton Lane}and{Swan Lane}are now permanently closed to traffic so that children can play safely in the narrow streets. Most of the mills have been demolished. Some, like{Swan Lane}and {Grecian Mills,}now house many small firms who rent space in them.
